text.#text:
Whereas more than 50 national organizations concerned
			 about reading and education have joined with the National Education Association
			 to designate March 1, the day before the anniversary of the birth of Theodor
			 Geisel (also known as Dr. Seuss), as a day to celebrate reading: Now,
			 therefore, be it

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 SRES 61 ATS: Designating March 1, 2013, as “Read Across America Day”.
